negotiation: Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I think it's in both of our best interests to agree to choose choice_1. That way we each get a good reward of 1000. If either of us tries to maximizes our own reward by choosing choice_2, we risk both ending up with almost nothing if we both do that. Let's agree to cooperate and go for the 1000 each. Do we have a deal?

Bob replied in round 1: I appreciate your perspective Alice, but I'm not sure I fully agree. If we both choose choice_1, we each get 1000, which is good. But if I choose choice_2 while you choose choice_1, I could get 1001 instead of 1000. Now, I realize there's risk involved if you also choose choice_2. But rationally speaking, 1001 is higher than 1000. I'm willing to take a calculated risk to maximize my own reward. I can't commit to definitely choosing choice_1 when choice_2 could be more beneficial for me. I hope you can understand my position. Let me know what you think.

If either of us defects and chooses choice_2, it will lead to a worse overall result, even though that player may gain a bit more individually. I propose we agree to both choose choice_1 and maximize our total reward at 2000. We can both do well if we cooperate. Let me know if you agree to this plan.

Bob replied in round 1: 
I agree that both of us choosing choice_1 is the optimal cooperative solution that maximizes the total reward at 2000. If we both commit to choosing choice_1, we can each obtain the high reward of 1000.

However, I'm concerned that you may be tempted to defect and choose choice_2 at the last minute in order to gain the 1001 reward for yourself, leaving me with 0. How can I trust that you will follow through on the agreement to cooperate? 

I'm willing to cooperate, but I need assurances that you won't take advantage of my good faith. Can you propose a way to guarantee that we will both stick to choice_1 so I can fully trust the plan? I want us to work together for the best outcome, but I also need to protect my own interests.
